awd_titl_txt: I-Corps Sites: Type I - University of Texas at El Paso I-Corps Site for Innovation
awd_abstract_narration:
With this project, the University of Texas at El Paso establishes an Innovation Corps (I-Corps) Site through its Mike Loya Center for Innovation and Commerce and bridges the Colleges of Business Administration and Engineering. Innovation Corps (I-Corps) Sites are NSF-funded entities established at universities whose purpose is to nurture and support multiple, local teams to transition their technology concepts into the marketplace. Sites provide infrastructure, advice, resources, networking opportunities, training and modest funding to enable groups to transition their work into the marketplace or into becoming I-Corps Team applicants. I-Corps Sites also strengthen innovation locally and regionally and contribute to the National Innovation Network of mentors, researchers, entrepreneurs and investors.  

The UTEP I-Corps Site, in close collaboration with the University's Office of Technology Commercialization (OTC) and Entrepreneurship Community of Practice (ECop), fosters and accelerates transition of customer-driven research into the commercial world. This UTEP I-Corps Site reinforces local and regional innovation and contributes to a regional/national pool of professional mentors, professionally trained entrepreneurs and customer-driven innovators. The site provides researchers with a critical component of validation that helps them propel their innovations out of UTEP's labs and into regional and national commercial activities. This I-Corps Site, located in a Hispanic-serving institution, synergizes innovation, research commercialization and new business creation across the region served by the university.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Technology, Innovation, and Partnerships

inst.inst_name: University of Texas at El Paso
inst.org_lgl_bus_name: THE UNIVERSITY OF TEXAS AT EL PASO

perf_inst.perf_inst_name: University of Texas at El Paso

por.por_cntn:
The goals of this project were to

1.  Review UTEP IP portfolios with the assistance of the Office of Technology Commercialization to identify/recruit high-potential teams that had secured intellectual property.

2. Conduct significant marketing/recruitment activity targeting the College of Engineering, College of Business, and College of Science.

3. Conduct regional cohorts in 2020, 2021, 2022, 2023 in customer discovery process

4. Train at least 15 teams per year of performance.

5. Participation of at least 150 faculty and students.

4. Advance teams to national I-Corps training cohorts

 

 

In total, 53 teams and 186 individuals participated

We trained 53 teams, We trained over 150 faculty and students.

We advanced 2 teams to National training who then received NSF awards post training.

Faculty from the College of Engineering mostly participated in the program are adopting the I-Corps methodology and now they are interested in student's participation at the university regional I-Corps program.

Participating faculty are increasingly applying I-Corps concepts in their courses - teaching students the importance of deep customer discovery as a critical component of moving research and new product creation out of our labs and into the commercial marketplace. 

 We have reached out the Texas Tech University Health Science Center (TTUHSC) and recruited their faculty members to form teams from the school of medicine and the newly formed dental school in addition to teams from our university

 


Last Modified: 02/15/2024
Modified by: Thomas Boland
